title: Sōsa
text:
is a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> located in <a href="Chiba%20Prefecture">Chiba Prefecture</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. , the city had an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 35,674 in 14,688 households and a <a href="population%20density">population density</a> of 350 persons per km². The total area of the city is .
Geography.
Sōsa is located in far northeastern Chiba Prefecture. It is bordered to the north by the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a> on the southwest. The land is mostly flat, and much is from 40 to 50 meters above sea level in average elevation.
The northern section, a mixture of valleys, ports and rice fields, consists of a plateau made up of complicated terrain and features. The southern half consists of flat terrain facing <a href="Kuj%C5%ABkuri%20Beach">Kujūkuri Beach</a>.
Through the center of the city runs both the Japan Railways (JR) <a href="S%C5%8Dbu%20Main%20Line">Sōbu Main Line</a> and <a href="Japan%20National%20Route%20126">Japan National Route 126</a>, which run east-west. To the west of the center of Sosa is <a href="Japan%20National%20Route%20296">Japan National Route 296</a>, which runs north-south.
Neighboring municipalities.
Chiba Prefecture
Climate.
Sōsa has a <a href="Humid%20subtropical%20climate">Humid subtropical climate</a> (Köppen "Cfa") characterized by warm summers and cool winters with light to no snowfall. The average annual temperature in Sōsa is 15.0 °C. The average annual rainfall is 1557 mm with September as the wettest month. The temperatures are highest on average in August, at around 25.9 °C, and lowest in January, at around 5.1 °C.
History.
Sōsa was founded on January 23, 2006 as a result of the merger between the former city of <a href="Y%C5%8Dkaichiba%2C%20Chiba">Yōkaichiba</a>, and the former town of <a href="Nosaka%2C%20Chiba">Nosaka</a> (from <a href="S%C5%8Dsa%20District%2C%20Chiba">Sōsa District</a>).
A 8 December 1915
B 3 November 1948
C 31 March 1954
D 1 July 1954
E 17 July 1954
F 23 January 2006
Government.
Sōsa has a <a href="mayor-council">mayor-council</a> form of government with a directly elected mayor and a <a href="unicameral">unicameral</a> city council of 18 members. Sōsa contributes one member to the Chiba Prefectural Assembly. In terms of national politics, the city is part of <a href="Chiba%2010th%20district">Chiba 10th district</a> of the <a href="House%20of%20Representatives%20of%20Japan">lower house</a> of the <a href="Diet%20of%20Japan">Diet of Japan</a>.
Economy.
Sōsa is a regional commercial center whose economy is primarily agricultural. Sōsa is well known for growing trees that are sold all over Japan.
Transportation.
Railway.
 <a href="JR%20East">JR East</a> – <a href="S%C5%8Dbu%20Main%20Line">Sōbu Main Line</a>
